==Events==
*[[1158]] &ndash; [[Munich]] is founded by [[Henry the Lion]] on the banks of the river [[Isar]].
*[[1216]] &ndash; [[First Barons' War]]: Prince [[Louis VIII of France|Louis of France]] captures the city of [[Winchester]] and soon conquers over half of the [[Kingdom of England]].
*[[1276]] &ndash; While taking exile in [[Fuzhou]] in southern China, away from the advancing [[History of the Song Dynasty#Mongol invasion and end of the Song Dynasty|Mongol invaders]], the remnants of the [[Song Dynasty]] court hold the coronation ceremony for the young prince Zhao Shi, making him [[Emperor Duanzong of Song]].
*[[1285]] &ndash; [[Mongol invasions of Vietnam|Second Mongol invasion of Vietnam]]: Forces led by Prince [[Trần Quang Khải]] of the [[Trần Dynasty]] destroy most of the invading [[Yuan Dynasty|Mongol]] naval fleet in a battle at Chuong Duong.
*[[1287]] &ndash;  [[Kublai Khan]] defeats the force of Nayan and other traditionalist [[Borjigin]] princes in East [[Mongolia]] and [[Manchuria]].
*[[1381]] &ndash; [[Richard II of England]] meets leaders of [[Peasants' Revolt]] on [[Blackheath, London|Blackheath]]. The [[Tower of London]] is stormed by rebels who enter without resistance.
*[[1645]] &ndash; [[English Civil War]]: [[Battle of Naseby]] &ndash; 12,000 [[Roundhead|Royalist]] forces are beaten by 15,000 [[Long Parliament|Parliamentarian]] soldiers.
*[[1667]] &ndash; The [[Raid on the Medway]] by the [[Netherlands|Dutch]] fleet in the [[Second Anglo-Dutch War]] ends. It had lasted for five days and resulted in the worst ever defeat of the [[Royal Navy]]. 
*[[1775]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: the [[Continental Army]] is established by the [[Continental Congress]], marking the birth of the [[United States Army]].
*[[1777]] &ndash; The [[Flag of the United States|Stars and Stripes]] is adopted by Congress as the Flag of the United States.
*[[1789]] &ndash; [[Mutiny on the Bounty]]: {{HMS|Bounty}} mutiny survivors including Captain [[William Bligh]] and 18 others reach [[Timor]] after a nearly {{convert|7,400|km|mi|abbr=on}} journey in an open boat.
*1789   &ndash; [[Whiskey]] distilled from [[maize]] is first produced by American clergyman the Rev [[Elijah Craig]]. It is named [[Bourbon whiskey|Bourbon]] because Rev Craig lived in [[Bourbon County, Kentucky]].
*[[1800]] &ndash; The French Army of [[Napoleon|First Consul Napoleon Bonaparte]] defeats the Austrians at the [[Battle of Marengo]] in Northern Italy and re-conquers Italy.
*[[1807]] &ndash; Emperor [[Napoleon]]'s French [[Grande Armée]] defeats the [[Imperial Russia|Russian Army]] at the [[Battle of Friedland]] in Poland (modern Russian  [[Kaliningrad Oblast]]) ending the [[War of the Fourth Coalition]].
*[[1821]] &ndash; [[Badi VII]], king of [[Sennar (sultanate)|Sennar]], surrenders his throne and realm to [[Isma'il Pasha]], general of the [[Ottoman Empire]], ending the existence of that Sudanese kingdom.
*[[1822]] &ndash; [[Charles Babbage]] proposes a [[difference engine]] in a paper to the [[Royal Astronomical Society]] entitled "Note on the application of machinery to the computation of astronomical and mathematical tables".
*[[1830]] &ndash; Beginning of the [[French Algeria|French colonization of Algeria]]: 34,000 French soldiers begin their [[Invasion of Algiers in 1830|invasion of Algiers]], landing 27 kilometers west at [[Sidi Fredj]].
*[[1839]] &ndash; [[Henley Royal Regatta]]: the village of [[Henley-on-Thames]], on the [[River Thames]] in [[Oxfordshire]], stages its first [[regatta]].
*[[1846]] &ndash; [[Bear Flag Revolt]] begins &ndash; [[United States|Anglo]] settlers in [[Sonoma, California]], start a rebellion against Mexico and proclaim the [[California Republic]].
*[[1863]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Second Battle of Winchester]] &ndash; a [[United States|Union]] garrison is defeated by the [[Army of Northern Virginia]] in the [[Shenandoah Valley]] town of [[Winchester, Virginia]].
*[[1863]] &ndash; Second Assault on the Confederate works at the [[Siege of Port Hudson]] during the American Civil War.
*[[1872]] &ndash; [[Trade union]]s are legalised in Canada.
*[[1900]] &ndash; [[Territory of Hawaii|Hawaii]] becomes a [[United States territory]].
*1900   &ndash; The [[Reichstag (German Empire)|Reichstag]] approves a second law that allows the expansion of the German navy.
*[[1907]] &ndash; Norway grants women the [[women's suffrage|right to vote]].
*[[1919]] &ndash; [[Alcock and Brown|John Alcock and Arthur Whitten Brown]] depart from [[St. John's, Newfoundland]] on the first nonstop [[transatlantic flight]].
*[[1926]] &ndash; [[Brazil]] leaves the [[League of Nations]]
*[[1937]] &ndash; [[Pennsylvania]] becomes the first (and only) state of the United States to celebrate [[Flag Day (United States)|Flag Day]] officially as a [[state holiday]].
<!-- [[Action Comics 1]] was not released on June 14; it was released on April 14 with a cover date of June 1938 -->
*  1937   &ndash; U.S. House of Representatives passes the [[Marihuana Tax Act of 1937|Marihuana Tax Act]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: Paris falls under German occupation, and Allied forces retreat.
*  1940   &ndash; The [[Soviet Union]] [[1940 Soviet ultimatum to Lithuania|presents an ultimatum to Lithuania]] resulting in Lithuanian loss of independence.
*  1940   &ndash; A group of 728 Polish political prisoners from [[Tarnów]] become the first residents of the [[Auschwitz concentration camp]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[June deportation]]: the first major wave of Soviet mass deportations and murder of [[Estonia]]ns, [[Latvia]]ns and [[Lithuania]]ns, begins.
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: After several failed attempts, the British Army abandons [[Operation Perch]], its plan to capture the [[Nazi Germany|German]]-occupied town of [[Caen]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: Filipino troops of the 15th, 66th and 121st Infantry Regiment, Philippine Commonwealth Army, USAFIP-NL liberate the captured in [[Ilocos Sur]] and start the [[Battle of Bessang Pass]] in Northern Luzon.
*[[1949]] &ndash; Albert II, a [[rhesus monkey]], rides a [[V2 rocket]] to an altitude of 134&nbsp;km (83&nbsp;mi), thereby becoming the first [[monkeys in space|monkey in space]].
*[[1951]] &ndash; [[UNIVAC I]] is dedicated by the [[United States Bureau of the Census|U.S. Census Bureau]].
*[[1952]] &ndash; The [[keel]] is laid for the nuclear submarine {{USS|Nautilus|SSN-571|6}}.
*[[1954]] &ndash; U.S. President [[Dwight D. Eisenhower]] signs a bill into law that places the words "under God" into the United States [[Pledge of Allegiance]].
*[[1955]] &ndash; [[Chile]] becomes a signatory to the [[Buenos Aires Convention|Buenos Aires copyright treaty]].
*[[1959]] &ndash; [[Disneyland Monorail System]], the first daily operating monorail system in the [[Western Hemisphere]], opens to the public in [[Anaheim, California]].
*[[1959]] &ndash; A group of Dominican exiles depart from [[Cuba]] and land in the [[Dominican Republic]] with the intent of overthrowing the totalitarian government of [[Rafael Trujillo]]. All but four are killed or executed.
*[[1962]] &ndash; The [[European Space Research Organisation]] is established in Paris – later becoming the [[European Space Agency]].
*[[1966]] &ndash; The [[Roman Curia|Vatican]] announces the abolition of the ''[[Index Librorum Prohibitorum]]'' ("index of prohibited books"), which was originally instituted in [[1557]].
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Mariner program]]: ''[[Mariner 5]]'' is launched towards [[Venus]].
*[[1967]] &ndash; The [[China|People's Republic of China]] tests its first [[hydrogen bomb]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; [[Falklands War]]: [[Argentina|Argentine]] forces in the capital [[Stanley, Falkland Islands|Stanley]] [[Conditional surrender|conditionally surrender]] to British forces.
*[[1985]] &ndash; [[TWA Flight 847]] is hijacked by [[Lebanon|Lebanese]] Islamist organization [[Hezbollah]] shortly after take-off from [[Athens]], Greece.
*[[1994]] &ndash; The [[1994 Stanley Cup riot]] occurs after the New York Rangers win the [[Stanley Cup]] from Vancouver, causing an estimated {{$|CAD}}1.1 million, leading to 200 arrests and injuries. 
*[[2002]] &ndash; [[Near-Earth object|Near-Earth asteroid]] [[2002 MN]] misses the [[Earth]] by {{convert|75000|mi|km}}, about one-third of the distance between the Earth and the [[Moon]].
